name: Titanium.App
summary: The top-level App module is mainly used for accessing information about the application at runtime, and for sending or listening for system events.

events.name: accessibilitychanged
events.summary: Fired by the system when the device's accessibility service is turned on or off.

properties.name: enabled
properties.summary: Whether accessibility is now enabled or disabled.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: close
events.summary: Fired by the system when the application is about to be terminated.
events.description: It is the last event that can be received before the application gets closed.

events.name: memorywarning
events.summary: Fired when the app receives a warning from the operating system about low memory availability.

events.name: pause
events.summary: Fired when the application transitions from active to inactive state on a multitasked system.
events.description:
This event fires when the user leaves the application or for certain types of temporary interruptions such as a notification or incoming phone call. On an iPad application with split view enabled, the event will be called once the application is put in the background and a different split view application is focused.

See the applicationWillResignActive section of the official Apple documentation about Monitoring Application State Changes for the exact behavior that triggers this event.

Note that calls to functions that modify the UI during this event may be partially executed, up to the UI call before the suspension. See paused event. If this happens, the remainder of the code will be executed after the application is resumed, but before the resume event is triggered.

events.name: paused
events.summary: Fired when the application transitions to the background on a multitasked system.
events.description:
This event fires when putting the application in the background using the home button or when using the sleep/wake or power button.

This event fires when the user leaves the application.

See the applicationDidEnterBackground section of the official Apple documentation about Monitoring Application State Changes for the exact behavior that triggers this event.

events.name: proximity
events.summary: Fired when the proximity sensor changes state.
events.description:
The proximity sensor detects whether the device is being held up to the user's ear, and shuts down the display.

Proximity events are only fired when proximityDetection is true.

properties.name: state
properties.summary: Proximity state value.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: uncaughtException
events.summary: Fired when an uncaught JavaScript exception occurs.
events.description: This event will occur in both production and development builds, allowing you to warn the user that an error has occured, and log more information to help you fix any bugs.

properties.name: message
properties.summary: The error message.

properties.name: line
properties.summary: The line where the error occurred.

properties.name: sourceId
properties.summary: A unique identification for the source file.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: The type of error.

properties.name: sourceURL
properties.summary: The URL to the source file.

properties.name: backtrace
properties.summary: The backtrace of function calls when the error occurred.

properties.name: title
properties.summary: The title for the error.

properties.name: sourceName
properties.summary: The name of the source file.

properties.name: lineSource
properties.summary: The line source reference.

properties.name: lineOffset
properties.summary: The offset on the line where the error occurred.

properties.name: jsStack
properties.summary: The javascript stack trace of the exception.

properties.name: javaStack
properties.summary: The java stack trace of the exception.

properties.name: stack
properties.summary: The javascript stack trace of the exception.

properties.name: nativeStack
properties.summary: The native platform stack trace of the exception.

properties.name: column
properties.summary: The column offset on the line where the error occured.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: resume
events.summary: Fired when the application returns to the foreground on a multitasked system.
events.description:
This event fires when putting the application in the background using the home button and when using the sleep/wake or power button.

Note that this event does not fire for pauses resulting from notifications or incoming phone calls.

See the applicationWillEnterForeground section of the official Apple documentation about Monitoring Application State Changes for the exact behavior that triggers this event.

events.name: resumed
events.summary: Fired when the application returns to the foreground.
events.description:
This event fires when the application enters the foreground with the resume event or returns to focus after a notification or incoming phone call. On an iPad with split view enabled, this event will be called every time the application resized.

See the applicationDidBecomeActive section of the official Apple documentation about Monitoring Application State Changes for the exact behavior that triggers this event.

Note: This event will not be fired for URL's in iOS 10+ that are handled by the Modules.SafariDialog or Titanium.UI.WebView, because Apple does not call the applicationDidBecomeActive for URL-handling anymore. Instead, use the handleurl event in Titanium.App.iOS.

events.name: started
events.summary: Fired after the "app.js" or "alloy.js" gets executed during application startup.
events.description: The intention of this event is for modules to defer firing their own startup related events until the app developer's main script has had a chance to add listeners for them.

events.name: keyboardframechanged
events.summary: Fired when the soft keyboard is presented, on and off the screen.
events.description:
This event fires when the application presents the soft keyboard on/off the screen . The event returns the dictionary keyboardFrame containing x, y, height and width keys, corresponding to the frame of the keyboard with respect to the screen coordinates.

On Titanium SDK 4.0.0 and later the event also contains a second parameter animationDuration representing the duration of the animation for the presentation and dismissal of the soft keyboard.

Note that the keyboard height and width properties will not be accurate when the keyboard is being dissmissed.

properties.name: keyboardFrame
properties.summary: A dictionary with keys x, y, width and height representing the frame of keyboard on screen.

properties.name: animationDuration
properties.summary: The duration of the keyboard animation. This parameter is only available on Titanium SDK 4.0.0 and later.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: significanttimechange
events.summary: Fired when there is a significant change in the time.
events.description: Examples of significant time changes include the arrival of midnight, an update to the time by a carrier, and the change to daylight savings time. If your application is currently in paused state, this message will be is queued until your application returns to the foreground, at which point it is delievered. If multiple changes occur, only the most recent one is delievered.

properties.name: id
properties.summary: Identifier of the clicked shortcut item.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: userinteraction
events.summary: Called whenever an interaction with the window occurred. To be used together with the trackUserInteraction property.
events.description:
Implement this method if you wish to know that the user has interacted with the device in some way while your app is running.

Note that this callback will be invoked for the touch down action that begins a touch gesture, but may not be invoked for the touch-moved and touch-up actions that follow.

See also:

  • Android: See the onUserInteraction callback
  • iOS: See the sendEvent delegate

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.summary: The name of the event to fire.

parameters.name: param
parameters.summary: A parameter to be passed to the system event.

methods.name: getArguments
methods.summary: Returns the arguments passed to the application on startup.
methods.description: On Android, fetch the rootActivity object and read its intent property to retrieve the parameters used to launch the application activity. Note that this intent will change when a "newintent" event has been fired.

properties.name: accessibilityEnabled
properties.summary: Indicates whether Accessibility is enabled by the system.

properties.name: analytics
properties.summary: Indicates whether Analytics is enabled, determined by tiapp.xml.

properties.name: copyright
properties.summary: Application copyright statement, determined by tiapp.xml.

properties.name: currentService
properties.summary: A reference to the currnet background service running when the application is placed in the background.

properties.name: deployType
properties.summary:
Build type that reflects how the application was packaged.

Returns one of the following values:

  • development (Simulator)
  • test (Device)
  • production (App Store / Adhoc)

properties.name: description
properties.summary: Application description, determined by tiapp.xml.

properties.name: disableNetworkActivityIndicator
properties.summary: Prevents network activity indicator from being displayed.
properties.description:
Setting this property to true disables display of the network activity indicator when network activity is in progress. If the network activity indicator is currently visible, it is hidden immediately.

NOTE: In general, the user should always be made aware of network activity. The network activity indicator should only be disabled for very brief network activity (a few seconds).

properties.name: forceSplashAsSnapshot
properties.summary: Shows the application's splash screen on app resume.
properties.description: Note: This only works on device. When the app goes to the background a screenshot of the current app state is taken. When the app resumes that screenshot is shown for brief moment. To disable this behavior, set this property to true and the default splash screen will show on app resume instead.

properties.name: guid
properties.summary: Application globally-unique ID, determined by tiapp.xml.
properties.description: This value is system-generated and consistent through all versions.

properties.name: id
properties.summary: Application ID, from tiapp.xml.
properties.description: The application ID is a required property that must be specified when creating a new project.

properties.name: idleTimerDisabled
properties.summary: Determines whether the screen is locked when the device is idle.

properties.name: installId
properties.summary: The install ID for this application.
properties.description: The application install ID is a unique identifier (UUID) for this install of the application. It is not modified by application updates; only when an application is initially installed, or removed and re-installed.

properties.name: keyboardVisible
properties.summary: Indicates whether or not the soft keyboard is visible.

properties.name: name
properties.summary: Application name, determined by tiapp.xml.

properties.name: proximityDetection
properties.summary: Determines whether proximity detection is enabled.

properties.name: proximityState
properties.summary: Indicates the state of the device's proximity sensor, according to the proximity event.
properties.description:
This property is true when the proximity sensor is close to the user.

When proximityDetection is disabled, the value of this property is undefined.

properties.name: publisher
properties.summary: Application publisher, from tiapp.xml.

properties.name: sessionId
properties.summary: Unique session identifier for the current continuous run of the application.

properties.name: trackUserInteraction
properties.summary: Indicates whether or not the user interaction shoud be tracked.
properties.description: Use the userinteraction event to get notified about user interaction. For Android, user-interactions are controlled by the event and do not require this property to be set explicitely. For iOS, this is done to prevent additional overhead.

properties.name: url
properties.summary: Application URL, from tiapp.xml.

properties.name: version
properties.summary: Application version, from tiapp.xml.
